text: A way to automate setting association labels without having to use custom APIs, e.g. in a workflow set the association label to x, if meet y criteria
This is the biggest reason I’m not using them.

looks like the team is working on it but no ETA:

<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Set-Association-Labels-On-Records-via-a-Workflow/idi-p/580501#:~:text=Upvotes-,HubSpot%20Updates,-zeke|https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Set-Association-Labels-On-Records-via-a-Workflow/idi-p/580501#:~:text=Upvotes-,H[…]ot%20Updates,-zeke>

Pretty much was our thinking behind it. Opening up conditional hubl inside of dnd areas makes things weird / harder to reason about. We'd have to provide the additional context that drives the conditions _some how_. (field prompts at insert time for "developer sections", support for macros from the template context, etc).

I think it's a bunch more complexity for something we haven't really heard there was a need for. "Sections" was a means by which we at least tried to make fragments of a layout reusable. We may be revisiting "sections" next year to add some new functionality and we can try to keep this use case in mind though.
